data.title: Student Honors and Awards
data.meta_description: The Mount love to honor its students. Find out who is on the Dean's List, who received prominent scholarships and who earned an award at the Academic Honors and Awards Convocation.
data.text:
The gift of Monsignor Hugh J. Phillips, Class of 1931, President Emeritus, in memory of Edward J. Flanagan, USMC, Class of 1951. The Flanagan Prize is awarded to the member of the senior class who best represents the tradition of Mount St. Mary’s University in scholarship, conduct, and leadership.

Established by Thomas and Irene Powell as a tribute to Patrick Goles, Class of 1964, Past President of the National Alumni Association, Chairman and Trustee Emeritus. This prize honors and recognizes the outstanding leadership of Mr. Goles to his alma mater and the Church and is presented to a junior who exemplifies the Mount’s four pillars of Faith, Discovery, Leadership, and Community in his/her work on campus.

Established by Mrs. Janice O’Malley and her late husband, Peter F. O’Malley Jr., in loving memory of Peter’s parents, for the care, affection, leadership and service they generously gave to family, friends and the community. This award is intended to encourage today’s youth to live their lives modeled on that of Thomas Merton, an influential 20th century American Catholic author. The award is given to only one student who has demonstrated exceptional community service and who strives to live out Mount St. Mary’s University mission.

Established in 2005 by the Sean Popper Foundation, in memory of Sean Popper, Class of 2002, son of Christopher C. Popper, Class of 1976 and Denise Buegler Popper, Class of 1977, to perpetuate Sean’s zest for life and to serve as a reminder that great success can be achieved with enthusiasm and determination in the face of overwhelming obstacles and trials.

The Mount St. Mary’s University Career Center’s Scholarship Internship fund aims to reduce the financial challenges associated with participating in a wide range of low-paying or unpaid summer internships. Through the generosity of the scholarship established by alumni, in memory of Betsy Santos, the Class of 1989 Scholarship Fund offers grants for students who accept unpaid or low-paying internships and may need financial assistance in order to complete the internship.

Nik Kierniesky, Ph.D., was the first tenured member of the Department of Psychology at Mount St. Mary’s University, and was devoted to his students and to the integration of student research in the psychology major. The Nik Kierniesky “Keep the Faith” Scholarship is given to a rising senior who, in the judgement of the Department of Psychology faculty, shows promise in the area of psychological research.

The STEM Leadership Scholarship at Mount St. Mary's University is designed to support rising sophomore, junior and senior students majoring or minoring in biochemistry, biology, chemistry, computer science, cybersecurity, data science, environmental science, health science, mathematics or neuroscience. This scholarship is funded through an endowment donated by the George I. Alden Trust.
